entry.title: Not Deft
entry.content:
Deft, NotDeft and Xapian

The number of my org notes in my deft directories have gone beyond 600. To search within the official deft interface becomes a bit clanky. So I finally decide to install notdeft with use the external search engine “Xapian”. One of the biggest advantages with notdeft is that you can have more granular search results using the right syntax.

For note-taking, I am also fond of Org-roam, which make bi-directional linking incredibly easy. However, an normal org-roam query does not do a full-text search. That's why I think notdeft is still relevant. The two packages complement, rather than, again each other for making your own desktop wiki.

deft is an emulation of Notational Velocity

Tags and Yasnippet Autocompletion

org-roam search for org files' “titles” and “roam tags”

In order to make notdeft to search tags, one can either add #+keywords (or #+filetags:) at the beginning of an org file.

cz's note: the mirrored keyword is to facilitate notdeft's Xapian query

I write a simple yasnippet for autocompletion.

# -*- mode: snippet ; require-final-newline: nil -*-
# key: roam
# name: roam-headings (roam)
# contributor: Chen Zhu [2020-09-20]
# cz's note: the mirrored keyword is to facilitate notdeft's Xapian query
# --
#+roam_alias:
#+roam_tags: ${1:TAG}
#+keywords: $1

This shows how the autocompletion work

roam-snippet

CJK search

Notdeft's Xapian does not search for Chinese characters by default. You need to enable xapian to search for CJK characters (see an Emacs-China discussion here)

(setenv "XAPIAN_CJK_NGRAM" "1")

Display markdown files in notdeft

I also enable a few secondary extensions (such as markdown files) to be “seen” by notdeft. The code (setq notdeft-secondary-extensions '("md" "markdown" "txt")) in my will do the trick.
